snippet: A rigorous composer, clarinetist and tenor saxophonist, Jimmy Giuffre broke from the jazz mainstream in the 1960s, but by today’s standards, his music sounds modern.
abstract: Jimmy Giuffre, rigorous composer, clarinetist and tenor saxophonist, made a conscientious break from the jazz mainstream in 1960s after some commercial and critical success; live recordings from 1965 make up album The Jimmy Giuffre 3 & 4: New York Concerts, and illuminate murky period in his career.
lead_paragraph: A rigorous composer, clarinetist and tenor saxophonist, Jimmy Giuffre broke from the jazz mainstream in the 1960s, but by today’s standards, his music sounds modern.

headline.seo: Jimmy Giuffre’s Music Finds New Appreciation
headline.main: Booed in the ’60s, but Time Will Tell
headline.print_headline: Booed in the ’60s, but Time Will Tell
